How do we interact with a Talon jumping at us? We can dodge the W (which is honestly just a pathetic amount of damage outside of lane, not to mention that you don't have *time* to dodge the outgoing W without a blink, and that you can't realistically dodge to the side when he's going straight at you), or we can burst him before he reaches us (no DPS champion can do that unless absurdly fed).

How do we react to a Zed pressing R on us? We can't dodge his E or Q without a blink, because *all* he has to do is press it as soon as he comes out of R - meaning it's just not feasible to dodge it if you're a human. Sure, a scripter can do it, and you can do it against a Zed who is half-asleep, but the only counterplay to him outside of lane should not be {{item:3157}} or the team pulling him off me.

---

You blame enchanters for being braindead? Well, fine. Whatever. Whether or not they are is irrelevant. What does matter is that **regardless of how braindead enchanters were, there's basically 0 counterplay to most assassins, as basically every single one of them is point and click, or all but.**

So, the question is: Which is more fair: Assassins killing all squishies without counterplay, or enchanters completely negating all assassins without counterplay? Be objective, here, and actually think about it. And don't just think of it from the standpoint of "just group lul" (because, realistically, only enchanters **were** able to stop them), or from the standpoint of an assassin (which is just to burst them faster). Think of it from a fair standpoint. What is most fair to tanks, bruisers, mages, assassins, marksmen, *and* enchanters? One class being invalidated when one other class is nearby, or one class completely wiping the floor with the entirety of two classes, and all of a third class that isn't more skilled than them?

"As most enchanters tend to be the easy counterplay to anything.

you'd think, but the AD assassins benefit from ADCs being both strong and weak. If ADCs are strong then they still benefit from the extra damage scaling (particularly the "skirmisher" style assassins), but if ADCs are weak then they can build their tailored items without much concern over not being able to take down the ADCs. 

They still have the damage to completely obliterate anything that isn't a pure tank, but also the mobility to pick their fights to avoid tanks. While having enough DPS to 1v1 tanks.

The best solution would be to give assassins their own primary stat, but it's by no means the easiest solution. Not that they haven't already put more net effort into numerous class item reworks than it would take to add a new primary.

Not really. 

They were a symptom of the problem, but not the problem itself.

The real problem is that the "assassin fantasy" doesn't fit into the game, but more importantly it absolutely can't exist in the game if you're going to attach them to the stats of the classes which they are intended to counter (which is apparently mages and marksmen). If they wanted assassins to exist effectively in the game, without causing the constant arms race and issues that now plague the game, then they needed to add them with a new primary stat other than AD/AP/Health.

No one asked for this. There is a thing called a "middle ground," if you  haven't heard of it let me give you the definition: 

**_an area of compromise or possible agreement between two extreme positions, especially political ones._**

This is meta IS entirely Riot's fault. They have a history of balancing between one extreme to another and this meta is no different. Just because people asked for more damage does not mean they asked for this or are the cause of it.

Tanks use to be the answer to all of those. ADCs and supports aren't what stopped assassins and all-in attacks.

You'd think with marksmen and damage over time being out of favor, tanks would be seeing a huge spike in winrate, but they get deleted just as much as any other class.

Sure, some people will complain but for the most part, the game is much healthier today, than it was during S7.
